choices.text: Annual leave
Exam
Study
Sick

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Please list any Consultants away on leave below

elements.name: question6
elements.html:
Trainee Performance Key

Not Satisfactory

Borderline

Satisfactory

Well above Average

- Not satisfactory

- Not meeting expectations for level of training

- Regular &/or significant omissions or errors

- Little, slow &/or inconsistent progress

- Requires frequent correction or instruction

- Requires intense monitoring and supervision compared to expected for level of training

- Borderline performance

- Not meeting expectations for level of training

- Some minor omissions or errors

- Requires above average instruction for level of training

- Requires further training to improve

- Satisfactory

- Performs as expected for level of training

- Requires average level of instruction or correction for level

- Performs consistently above level of training

- No omissions or errors

- Requires minimal instruction or correction

rows.text: Is developing a knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and pathology relating to the common disease processes of most common paediatric surgical conditions.
Basic knowledge of paediatric surgical conditions – can discuss key points of most conditions.
Demonstrates mechanisms to correct knowledge deficits, rarely fails to say “I don’t know” to the same question when asked on another occasion.
Demonstrates familiarity with common paediatric surgical texts and journals during discussions with trainers.
Routinely utilises knowledge together with results of investigations to explain clinical manifestations of common elective paediatric surgical conditions.
Uses knowledge to analyse clinical findings

elements.name: question34
elements.title: Global Assessment of Basic Clinical Science knowledge
elements.description: Select the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in basic clinical sciences knowledge

choices.text: Has not yet satisfactorily achieved early Mid-SET competencies In Clinical Science Knowledge
Satisfactory achievement of all early Mid-SET competencies in Clinical Science Knowledge
Showing progression towards critical competencies In Clinical Science Knowledge but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Mid-SET critical competencies in Clinical Science Knowledge
Achieved Mid-SET critical competencies and progressing well in Senior SET in Clinical Science Knowledge

elements.name: question46
elements.title: Verbal description of clinical assessment / Case Presentations

rows.text: Takes a comprehensive and pertinent history
Organised in standard format
Able to discuss clinical relevance of clinical signs.
Maintains accurate and complete medical records and summaries
Legible / electronic fluent
Evidence of reasonable organisation of findings and conclusions
Thorough examination
Competent when eliciting symptoms and signs in a cooperative patient in a controlled environment
Obtains clinical information in a manner cognisant of cultural and social factors

elements.name: question49
elements.title: Demonstration of Clinical Competence in Diagnosis

rows.text: Good interpretation of clinical features. Readily recognises and manages straightforward clinical situations.
Recognises changes in clinical situations.
Recognises most common issues of paediatric surgical significance
Recognises complications early
“Hands-on”, fully involved approach to post-operative care

elements.name: question51
elements.title: Global Assessment of Medical Expertise
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Medical Expertise

choices.text: Has not yet satisfactorily achieved early Mid-SET competencies In Medical Expertise
Satisfactory achievement of all early Mid-SET competencies in Medical Expertise
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Medical Expertise but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Mid-SET critical competencies in Medical Expertise
Achieved Mid-SET critical competencies and progressing well in Senior SET in Medical Expertise

pages.name: page2

rows.text: Recognises significance of clinical findings. Appropriately seeks guidance to manage the clinical situation
Recognises and responds to paediatric patients specific needs
Differentiates between paediatric specific and adult specific specialisation and competencies
Aware of limitations
Appropriate reaction to emergencies, can initiate first response to most common paediatric surgical emergencies.
Seeks assistance appropriately
Protocol-appropriate selection and use of investigative tools
Aware of how the usefulness of most common investigations can be limited by commonly evident patient factors.
Safe, efficient and cost-effective choice of investigations
Can interpret common investigations, seeks expert mentoring of interpreting unfamiliar investigations
A structured management plan is always put forward. Aware of treatment options used for common paediatric elective surgical presentations.
Prompt flagging of patient complications
Manages patients with sensitivity to physical, social, cultural and psychological needs
Identifies and manages risks by seeking appropriate advice and authorisation
Ensures appropriate use of fluids, electrolytes, medications and blood products including their adjustment according to patient progress

elements.name: question17
elements.title: Global Assessment of Clinical Judgement
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Clinical Judgement

choices.text: Has not yet satisfactorily achieved early Mid-SET competencies In Clinical Judgment
Satisfactory achievement of all early Mid-SET competencies in Clinical Judgment
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Clinical Judgement but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Mid-SET critical competencies in Clinical Judgment
Achieved Mid-SET critical competencies and progressing well in Senior SET in Clinical Judgment

pages.title: Judgement  Clinical Decision-making
pages.description: Application of knowledge, clinical information, and signs elicited to form a management plan

rows.text: Excellent pre-operative preparation
On time to theatre. Follows theatre protocols
Able to deconstruct observed technical skills and cognitively rehearse and then practice them.
Meticulous technique for all simple surgical skills. Competent hand-eye co-ordination Knot tying secure Delicate with tissues
Can perform steps of common paediatric surgical operations
Acknowledges their own limits, and when it is time to ask for assistance.
Can sequentially talk through the steps of common elective procedures and anticipate the instruments required for each
Identifies that different techniques are utilised and notes the advantages and disadvantages of differing approaches.
Effective and proactive assistant in procedures
Recognises the level of skill required differs in different stages of a procedure and in different patients according to anatomy, pathology and comorbidity.
Safe and constantly improving knowledge of anatomy of common elective procedures
Verbally demonstrates surgical judgement during procedures
Able to maintain surgical judgement and safely complete surgical procedures under pressure while supervised
Can follow and understand changes in operative plan made by consultant, can readily discuss factors contributing to the need for a change in plan.

elements.name: question20
elements.title: Global Assessment of Technical Skills
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Technical Skills

choices.text: Has not yet satisfactorily achieved early Mid-SET competencies In Technical Skills
Satisfactory achievement of all early Mid-SET competencies in Technical Skills
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Technical Skills but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Mid-SET critical competencies in Technical Skills
Achieved Mid-SET critical competencies and progressing well in Senior SET in Technical Skills

rows.text: Demonstrates a genuine interest in ad hoc and structured teaching
Well prepared presentations delivered clearly and logically
Clear study plan and preparation for the Pathophysiology Examination
Recognises performance gaps in junior medical officers
Reflects on own performance and improvement and demonstrates this to mentors by inquiry and seeking feedback
Shows an interest in learning through research
Recognises value of research knowledge applied to clinical practice
Shows initiative and independence (above average)
Good grasp of statistics and research method

elements.name: question22
elements.title: Publications
elements.commentText: List current projects and research involvement:

rows.text: Conscientious with audit
Pursues opportunities to present at meetings

elements.name: question23
elements.title: Global Assessment of Scholar and Teacher
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Scholar and Teacher

choices.text: Has not yet satisfactorily achieved early Mid-SET competencies In Scholar and Teacher
Satisfactory achievement of all early Mid-SET competencies in Scholar and Teacher
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Scholar and Teacher but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Mid-SET critical competencies in Scholar and Teacher
Achieved Mid-SET critical competencies and progressing well in Senior SET in Scholar and Teacher

rows.text: Attentively listens, adapts and sets an appropriate style of communication for patients, families, peers and colleagues.
Sensitive to verbal and non-verbal cues received from patients and families especially regarding their serious concerns and can relay these to their senior colleagues
Communicates with children in a way appropriate to developmental level
Provides information enabling informed consent for Mid-SET procedures
Transfers care effectively to other relevant clinicians and non-hospital carers. Ensures family doctor is informed of significant changes in patients status
Treats referring clinicians with respect and support
Always willing to help, even if personally inconvenient
Active participation in team briefing and debriefing, can lead at times
Good rapport with peers, initiates resolution of misunderstanding
Skilled at defusing problems in surgical team
Actively seeks opinions of nursing and ancillary staff about concerns for patients

elements.name: question28
elements.title: Global Assessment of Communication, Collaboration and Teamwork
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Communication, Collaboration and Teamwork

choices.text: Has not yet satisfactorily achieved early Mid-SET competencies in Communication, Collaboration and Teamwork
Satisfactory achievement of all early Mid-SET competencies in Communication, Collaboration and Teamwork
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Communication, Collaboration and Teamwork but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Mid-SET critical competencies in Communication, Collaboration and Teamwork
Achieved Mid-SET critical competencies and progressing well in Senior SET in Communication, Collaboration and Teamwork

rows.text: Functions well as member of team, takes responsibility for allocated role
Consults well with colleagues and other professionals
Is able to review ward patients and be ready for theatre on time.
Uses resources effectively for patient care and balances them with patient needs
Willing to contribute to health services management
Appropriate co-ordination and use of other personnel

elements.name: question31
elements.title: Global Assessment of Leadership
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Leadership

choices.text: Has not yet satisfactorily achieved early Mid-SET competencies in Leadership
Satisfactory achievement of all early Mid-SET competencies in Leadership
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Leadership but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Mid-SET critical competencies in Leadership
Achieved Mid-SET critical competencies and progressing well in Senior SET in Leadership

rows.text: Consistently deals with the challenges presented by different value systems
Assists patients and families to consider options and make decisions
Keeps family and carers informed about current status and next steps. Advises families and patients on relevant risk factors.
Recognises the impact on families and carers of rescheduling surgery, recognises the impact and potential outcomes for patients who are categorised for waiting lists.
Recognises key health issues arising from the different cultural values, identifies vulnerable populations that may have limited access to health care resources

elements.name: question33
elements.title: Global Assessment of Health Advocacy
elements.description: Select  the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Health Advocacy

choices.text: Has not yet satisfactorily achieved early Mid-SET competencies in Health Advocacy
Satisfactory achievement of all early Mid-SET competencies in Health Advocacy
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Health Advocacy but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Mid-SET critical competencies in Health Advocacy
Achieved Mid-SET critical competencies and progressing well in Senior SET in Health Advocacy

rows.text: Punctual. Up to date with work. Well organiseda genuine interest in ad hoc and structured teaching
Always completes tasks on time
Ready accessibility. Reliable and dependable
Efficient, anticipates well
Strong advocate for the sick child. Maintains accurate data on all patients and analyses their own clinical performance and outcomes to encourage continuous improvement.
Copes well. Responds well to problems.
In command in critical situation. Does not panic
Openly learns from errors. Resilient

elements.name: question37
elements.title: Professionalism
elements.commentText: List current projects and research involvement:

rows.text: Identifies and applies ethical principles related to paediatric surgery
Recognises medicolegal implications of paediatric surgical issues
Readily accountable for own decisions/actions
Responds constructively to criticism. Keen to rectify deficiencies. Proactive in organising own performance management plan if needed.
Supports colleagues and junior staff
Demonstrates insight into own performance
Honest Admits Mistakes
Does not repeat errors and addresses issues when advised Self-critical and insightful
Demonstrates self-health advocacy guided by acknowledging impact on patient care if principles of proactive management of own health including fatigue are not followed

elements.title: Global Assessment of Professionalism and Ethics
elements.description: Select the descriptor that best describes the Trainee's overall global progress in Professionalism and Ethics

choices.text: Has not yet satisfactorily achieved early Mid-SET competencies In Professionalism and Ethics
Satisfactory achievement of all early Mid-SET competencies in Professionalism and Ethics
Showing progression towards critical competencies in Professionalism and Ethics but needs further training and study
Has achieved all Mid-SET critical competencies in Professionalism and Ethics
Achieved Mid-SET critical competencies and progressing well in Senior SET in Professionalism and Ethics
